sentence.Network_en: His command of English was lamentable.
She shows a lamentable lack of understanding.
sentence.Network_cn: 她显得缺乏理解能力，实在令人遗憾。

sentence.Network_en: This lamentable state of affairs lasted until 1947.
sentence.Network_cn: 这一令人遗憾的事态一直持续至1947年。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 蓝宝词典 ... lambaste vt. 痛打 lamentable adj. 忧郁的，不快的 landfill n. 垃圾堆.
可字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 可爱〖 respectedandbeloved;respectable〗 可悲〖 deplorable;lamentable;sad〗 可鼻〖 goodsmell〗.
lament 哀悼lamentable 可悲的lamentation 哀伤
expectantly的翻译... ... edify 启迪, 熏陶, 教诲... lamentable 可悲的, 哀伤的, 可怜的... reaffirmation 再断言, 再确认.

list.abs: Dickinson laments : " too much sun Alexa eyes , the truth , like the sun , see the eye is also blind . "狄金森感叹：“阳光太灼眼，真理也如阳光，看到了，眼也瞎了。”
people lament the passing of the good old days .人们惋惜过去的好时光的流逝。
He composed a lament to the dead soldier ., 他为那位阵亡的战士谱写了一首挽歌.
lament for/over sb/sthlament over哀悼;悔改e.g. She lamented for us abut her wretched lot.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'mournful', also 'pitiable, regrettable'): from Old French, or from Latin lamentabilis, from the verb lamentari (see lament)

entry.tran: 令人扼腕的；令人嘘唏的；使人惋惜的
entry.def: If you describe something as lamentable, you mean that it is very unfortunate or disappointing.

example.ex: This lamentable state of affairs lasted until 1947...
example.tran: 这一令人遗憾的事态一直持续至1947年。

example.ex: His command of English was lamentable.

sentences.sentence: "tell thou the lamentable tale of me, And send the hearers weeping to their beds"- Shakespeare
"my finances were in a deplorable state"

auth_sentence.content: The lamentable friends, trailing their long black garments.

auth_sentence.content: He agrees that the episode was unfortunate, lamentable .
auth_sentence.res_content: He agrees that the episode was unfortunate, lamentable .

auth_sentence.content: Not only strange and admirable, but lamentable to think on.
auth_sentence.res_content: Not only strange and admirable, but lamentable to think on.
